channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Deep pothole on Winchcombe Road, after railway bridge, 13th October
item.description:
A previously repaired pothole opposite ‘The old parsonage’ on the main road through Gretton has opened back up and entire filling has been removed. The pothole is quite deep and needs re-filling as cars are having to cross on to the other side of the road to avoid it. I first spotted the issue last Wednesday, and it does not appear to have been reported already / there is no paint around it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gretton Road, Gretton, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: Multiple Potholes Dangerous to Cyclists, 13th October
item.description:
On entering Pittville Circus from Prestbury Road Roundabout, on the corner there are multiple patched potholes with the surrounding tarmac deteriorating and forming new potholes. This is a busy road and when cycling it is difficult to safely pick a smooth route through the rough tarmac and patched potholes whilst also sharing the busy road with cars. Please could this piece of road be resurfaced with a continuous and smooth road surface for the safety of cyclists. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pittville Circus, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Possible Infected Silver Birch Tree, 13th October
item.description:
The possible infected silver birch tree is in the street outside no.38 Clarence Square. There are some large honey-coloured fungal growths at the base of the tree. The tree itself looks quite stressed compared to other silver birch trees in the street after the dry summer.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 38, Clarence Square, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain blocked with leaves., 13th October
item.description:
Between 110 and 112 Cromwell Road. This is not a fault of Council… due to parking of Kholer Mira employees the Drain Cleaner is unable to reach the drains. Cones would be needed in advance!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 110, Cromwell Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
